random_localisation_strings.string: Retainer required to use this unit:
Best all time skill rating 1v1 naval
Best all time skill rating 2v2 naval
Best all time skill rating 3v3 naval
Best all time skill rating 4v4 naval

You are unable to build a fort.||Building a fort requires a general and you must be within your own province.||You also need the sufficient funds and enough open ground to build upon.||If you have a general and are within one of your own provinces, you need to either raise enough funds or choose a clearer area to build upon.
Siege weapons that cannot be moved following deployment cannot be used as reinforcements.
Drag and drop unit cards to change their position in the reinforcement queue.
Your daimyo. Left-click to see his character summary, right-click to see his character details.||Your daimyo is the head of the clan and will require a worthy son to follow in his footsteps.

The daimyo's brother; a general. Left-click to see his character summary, right-click to see his character details.||To assign a general a commission, select him and press one of the 'commission' buttons in the panel below.||Examine each general's details to choose the most suitable candidate.
The daimyo's young brother. Left-click to see his character summary.||Once the daimyo's brother comes of age, he will become a general.

The daimyo's daughter. Left-click to see her character summary.||An unwed daughter can be married to one of your generals; select her and press the 'marry' button on the panel below. An eligible partner may then be chosen.||An unwed daughter may also be married into other clans to increase diplomatic relations through the diplomacy panel.
The daimyo's daughter-in-law. Left-click to see her character summary.
The daimyo's daughter. Left-click to see her character summary.

The daimyo's young daughter. Left-click to see her character summary.||Once the daimyo's daughter comes of age, she may be married to one of your generals to increase his loyalty or may marry into another clan to strengthen diplomatic relations.

The daimyo's young son. Left-click to see his character summary.||Once the daimyo's son is ready to assume his adult responsibilities, he will become a general.||To appoint a son as the clan heir, select him and press the 'heir' button on the panel below.||Examine each son's details to choose the most suitable candidate.

The daimyo's son in law; a general. Left-click to see his character summary, right-click to see his character details.||To appoint a son as the clan heir, select him and press the 'heir' button on the panel below.||To assign a general a commission, select him and press one of the 'commission' buttons on the panel below.||Examine each general's details to choose the most suitable candidate.
The daimyo's widow. Left-click to see her character summary.||Depending on her traits, the daimyo's widow may have an effect upon the daimyo or the clan.
The daimyo's wife. Left-click to see her character summary.||Depending on her traits, the daimyo's wife may have an effect upon the daimyo or the clan.
A marriage requires an eligible partner.

A general in the daimyo's service. Left-click to see his character summary, right-click to see his character details.||To assign a general a commission, select him and press one of the 'commission' buttons on the panel below.||A general may also marry the daimyo's unwed daughter; select him and press the 'marry' button on the panel below. An eligible partner may then be chosen.

The daimyo's son; a general. Left-click to see his character summary, right-click to see his character details.||To appoint a son as the clan heir, select him and press the 'heir' button on the panel below.||To assign a general a commission, select him and press one of the 'commission' buttons on the panel below.||Examine each general's details to choose the most suitable candidate.
This family member is a hostage of the _ clan as part of your agreement with them.||If you break the deal, they will be killed.||If you keep to it, they will be returned in _ seasons.
Make heir. The daimyo’s heir will assume leadership of the clan when his father passes away.
This family general currently holds a commission. He must relinquish his office if he is to become heir.
Declaring an adult son as your heir will increase his loyalty.
Declaring an underage son as your heir will have no effect on his loyalty when he comes of age.
Disinheriting an underage heir will have no effect on his loyalty when he comes of age.
Disinheriting your adult heir will decrease his loyalty.
The selected character has already been declared as the daimyo's heir.

Your clan must be more famous before a general may be assigned this commission.||Fame is gained by fighting battles and conquering provinces and is also influenced by other factors, such as your daimyo's honour.
Left-click on this character in order to marry them to the selected clan member.
This commission is currently unassigned. Press this button to assign it to the selected general.||Assigning a commission to a general will increase his loyalty.
A general’s rank defines his ability in office. The selected general will have the following effects:
You may not assign a commission to the heir. If you wish to assign this commission to the selected character, he must first be disinherited by nominating another of the daimyo's sons as the heir.
The outgoing general has the following effects:

This commission is currently assigned to another general. Assigning it to the selected general will remove the current commissioner from his office.||Assigning a commission to a general will increase his loyalty.||Removing a general from office will decrease his loyalty.
The selected character has already been assigned this commission.
This commission is currently assigned to another general. Assigning it to the selected general will have them swap offices.||Swapping commissions between generals has no impact on their loyalty.
Fixed artillery units are stationary and therefore cannot be used as reinforcements.

Recruitment and travel turns||This number on the left shows the amount of turns it will take to recruit this unit.||The number on the right shows the amount of turns it will take for this unit to reach the recruiting general.||Generals can recruit units from the battlefield and the recruited units will travel directly to the general's location.
Scupper||Scupper ships that are no longer needed to save money on upkeep costs.
This fleet is suffering attrition because it is on the high seas. Move the fleet outside of this area to stop further attrition.
Left-click to add points, right-click to see more information.
You haven't got the required skill points to purchase this.
You have not met the skill requirements for this.
This skill belongs to another branch.
You cannot demolish castles, ports, and roads, or speciality buildings at their base level.

Hire geisha||Geisha are skilled musicians, dancers and poets, and they use their arts both to entertain and uplift.||Construct business buildings in other provinces to increase the number of geisha you can recruit at one time.

Hire ishin shishi||Ishin shishi are the “men of higher purpose” devoted to one thing: the reinstatement of divine Imperial rule.||Construct propaganda buildings in other provinces to increase the number of ishin shishi you can recruit at one time.

Hire shinobi||Shinobi are masters of subterfuge; they conduct espionage, sabotage and assassinations.||Construct traditional dojos in other provinces to increase the number of shinobi you can recruit at one time.

Hire shinsengumi||Shinsengumi are enforcers of the Shogun’s justice, coercing or subduing those who dare oppose his will.||Construct propaganda buildings in other provinces to increase the number of shinsengumi you can recruit at one time.

Hire foreign veteran||Foreign veterans are masters of warfare having fought, and survived, in many battles.||Construct trade ports in other provinces to increase the number of foreign veterans you can recruit at one time.
Hire geisha||Geisha agents can be used for missions of subterfuge.

Hire shirabyoshi||Shirabyoshi agents can be used to seduce enemy agents and entertain friendly generals and castle towns.||Construct clan buildings in other provinces to increase the number of shirabyoshi you can recruit at one time.

Hire junsatsushi||Junsatsushi agents are secret police specialising in bribery and detection of enemy agents.||Construct barter buildings in other provinces to increase the number of junsatsushi you can recruit at one time.
Hire sou||Sou are religious agents used to inspire your clan and demoralise the enemy.||Construct temples in other provinces to increase the number of sou you can recruit at one time.

Hire monomi||Monomi agents can be used for spying, sabotage and assassination.||Construct province speciality buildings in other provinces to increase the number of monomi you can recruit at one time.

Hire metsuke||Metsuke agents are secret police specialising in bribery and detection of enemy agents.||Construct markets in other provinces to increase the number of metsuke you can recruit at one time.

Hire missionary||Missionaries are religious agents used to inspire your clan and demoralise the enemy.||Construct chapels in other provinces to increase the number of missionaries you can recruit at one time.
Hire monk||Monks are religious agents used to inspire your clan and demoralise the enemy.||Construct temples in other provinces to increase the number of monks you can recruit at one time.
Hire ninja||Ninja agents can be used for spying, sabotage and assassination.||Construct sake dens in other provinces to increase the number of ninja you can recruit at one time.

Left-click to remove unit from queue, right-click for further information
Left-click to recruit this unit, right-click for further information

Your army is already full, to recruit a general you will need to disband one of your units.

You cannot afford to recruit this ship. Cost:
Your fleet is already full, to recruit this ship you will need to scupper another ship.
You cannot recruit a ship here while you the port is blockaded.
You cannot recruit a ship here while you the port is damaged.
You cannot recruit a ship here while you the port is damaged.
You cannot recruit a ship here while you the port is occupied by an enemy.

There is no path available from this unit's place of recruitment to the recruiting force.
You haven't got the required resource for recruiting this unit.
You cannot afford to recruit this unit. Cost:

The recruitment building for this unit is damaged and will need to be repaired first.
The population number is too low to recruit from, you will have to wait until it grows.
You have already recruited the maximum number of this unit already.
You cannot recruit this unit until you have studied and mastered the required art for it.
You cannot recruit this unit until you have constructed the additional building required for it.
You cannot afford to repair this item. Cost:
You can only repair ships within a port

Damaged Building||While a building is damaged, any effect or economic bonuses gained from it will be reduced.||You can leave it to repair slowly at no extra cost, or you can spend money to repair it within one turn using the 'Repair' button to the left.
Cancel repair of selected ships. Recouping:
Select damaged ships to use the repair feature
No repairs required for ships in this selection
You cannot demolish castles, ports, and roads, or speciality buildings at their base level.
Cannot disembark||You cannot disembark here as the land is inaccessible.
Cannot enlist a general||You already have your full quota of generals.
Cannot enlist a general||There are no candidates to recruit from.||Candidates are selected from your daimyos family or troops who have excelled themselves in battle.
Cannot enlist a general||You have insufficient funds.
Cannot repair||You have insufficient funds.||Disband an unused unit or increase taxes to raise funds.

Cannot hire a geisha||You have insufficient funds.||Disband an unused unit or increase taxes to raise funds.

The amount of these items you can own is limited. You currently have %d of %d.
Unavailable. You have not met the building or development requirements.
You are about to enter a tutorial battle. Click accept to continue or click cancel to return to the pre-battle screen where you can auto-resolve it and return to the campaign tutorial.

You now have the option to fight another tutorial battle on the 3D battlefield. The units in your army won’t be exactly the same as your army in the campaign. Click “accept” to fight, or “cancel” to go back and auto-resolve the battle. After the battle is done, you can return to the campaign.
You are about to fight a custom battle. As such you will be fighting with a customised army which may differ from the ones you have in the tutorial campaign.

This will be your first battle. The full game allows you to fight every battle on a 3D battlefield, but this demo lets you fight three tutorial battles only. All the others must be auto-resolved. Click “accept” to go the battlefield, or click cancel to go back and auto-resolve this battle and return to the campaign.
Left-click to select, right-click for further information
In winter, units will suffer losses due to attrition if they are in enemy territory. Move the unit outside of the enemy area to stop further attrition.
This unit is not replenishing because it is not in a castle town or settlement.
This unit is not replenishing because it is in enemy territory.
This unit is not replenishing because it doesn't have a general.
This unit is not replenishing because it is on board a ship.
This unit is not replenishing because it is being besieged.
Turns until this unit is fully replenished:
Stealth||For a short duration, this enables a unit to hide on any ground type and remain hidden even while running.||While activated, it also provides a bonus to charge and melee attacks.
Targeted Fire||This increases accuracy for a short amount of time.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.
Barrage||This increases the rate of fire for a short time.|| Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.

Banzai||This temporarily gives the unit unbreakable morale, plus an increase in movement speed and melee and charge attacks.||Once it has finished, the unit's speed and melee attacks are greatly reduced for a short time.
Banzai||This temporarily gives the ship unbreakable morale, plus an increase in melee attack and defence.
Battle speed||This increases a ship's rowing speed for a short period of time.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.
Blinding Grenades ability||Blinding grenades disorientate the enemy, reducing their melee attacks, movement speed and drastically affecting their missile accuracy.
Toggle canister shot||Canister shot effectively turns your guns into a giant shot gun! It is particularly effective at close range.||The only downside to canister shot is its limited range.

Swooping Crane||This arranges a cavalry unit into a moving, circular formation, enabling them to fire a constant rate of missiles at the enemy.||Because they are constantly moving, the horses will lose stamina while the ability is active.

Toggle carcass shot||Carcass shot is an incendiary shot that has a devastating area of effect.||Unfortunately, carcass shot leaves burning debris on the battle field. ||This can be hazardous to your troops as well as the enemy.
Loose Formation||Loose formation minimises casualties when under heavy fire, but makes them more vulnerable to melee and charge attacks.
Explosive Shell||High explosive shell with excellent fire power against wooden-hulled ships or depleted crews||Low accuracy weapon with small area of effect. Perfect against clusters of ships.
Toggle guard mode||This will put your troops on the defensive.||Guard mode makes your men hold position.||Even if an enemy unit routs, your men will remain in position and hold your line.
Toggle diamond formation||Diamond formation allows your cavalry to change direction in a much more timely manner.||It also provides your cavalry units with a charge bonus.
Mount/Dismount||Dismounting means you can enter buildings, climb castle walls and capture locations, but you lose all the benefits of being mounted.
Drop Engines||Dropping your engines means your crew can move freely.||Usage of this is limited but may be useful if you have no other units to complete objectives or want to flee potential threats
Suppressed|| This unit is now suppressed; it will move more slowly and have reduced morale

Encourage||Some command ships can encourage other vessels within their area of influence, increasing their melee attack, reload skill and accuracy.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Toggle explosive shell||Explosive shells are capable of significant damage to troops and buildings.||They can only be fired from howitzers and mortars. ||They rely on a timed fuse which can sometimes burn out early, resulting in them exploding before they reach the enemy.
Faster rowing||This increases ship movement for a short period of time.

Toggle fire and advance mode||Fire and advance provides constant covering fire whilst still advancing on the enemy.||Due to the complicated nature of reloading and moving through the forward lines, fire in advance is a very slow moving advancing technique.

Toggle fire at will||Fire at will allows your units to fire at enemies within range when they see fit. ||The effort of constantly firing and reloading will quickly tire your men and they will use their ammo quickly, but not wisely.

Flaming Arrows||Flaming arrows are more powerful than normal arrows and can also cause buildings to catch fire, but will be less effective in wet weather.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.

Flaming Arrows||Flaming arrows are more powerful than normal arrows and can also cause flammable objects to catch fire, but will be less effective in wet weather.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.
Detonate mines||Detonating mines will blow your enemy off their feet, literally!||A well timed detonation can wipe out a significant chunk of an enemy force.
Detonate mines||Detonating mines will blow your enemy off their feet, literally!||With improvements the fougasse has a bigger blast radius, capable of claiming more enemy lives than ever before.
Toggle grenade shot || Grenades are especially effective against tight infantry formations.

Toggle improved grenades ||Grenades are especially effective against tight infantry formations.||Improvements made in the development of grenades means they create far more shrapnel, claiming more lives. ||They have also seen improvements in reliability.

Toggle improved grenades||Grenades are especially effective against tight infantry formations.||Improvements made in the development of grenades means they create far more shrapnel, claiming more lives. ||They have also seen improvements in reliability.
Increased Range||For a short time, this increases the firing range of a unit.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.

Inspire||Left-click this button, then left-click on a unit to inspire them.||A general can choose to inspire a single unit for a short period of time, boosting their morale and greatly improving their marksmanship and melee skills.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.
Toggle light infantry behaviour||Light infantry behaviour orders your troops to spread out and find cover.||This is very effective if your troops are under artillery fire.
Toggle loose formation||Loose formation spreads units out, making them much harder to hit with missile attacks, but greatly reducing their ability to resist charges.
Toggle Fire On/Off||When toggled off, the selected ship will stop firing and will be unable to fire until switched on again.

Toggle shells||Shells are capable of significant damage to troops and buildings.||They can only be fired from howitzers and mortars. ||They rely on a timed fuse which can sometimes burn out early, resulting in them exploding before they reach the enemy.
Toggle spear square formation||This defensive formation is especially effective against cavalry charges.||While in this formation, the unit will be immobile and vulnerable to ranged attacks.
Toggle spear wall formation||This formation is effective against head on cavalry charges.||However, it is vulnerable to flanking manoeuvres.
Toggle plug bayonets||Fixing bayonets allows units to engage in melee attacks.||Once plug bayonets are fixed the units can no longer fire their weapons.
Toggle quicklime shot||Quicklime affects troops over a wide area.

Rally||A general can rally troops within his area of influence, shown by the blue circle.||All non-routing units within will receive a morale boost, while it will rally routing units. ||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Rally||An admiral can rally troops within his area of influence, shown by the blue circle.||All non-routing units within will receive a morale boost, while it will rally routing units. ||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.
Regroup Position||Left-click on this button, then left-click on the area of the battlefield where you want reinforcing or routing units to fall back to.
Increased Range||For a short time, this increases the firing range of a unit.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.

Toggle rank fire formation||This forms a unit into three ranks deep as they take turns to fire and reload, keeping up a constant rate of fire.||While in this formation, they take longer to form up and fire.
Rapid Advance||This increases a unit's speed for a short period of time.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.
Rapid Volley||This increases a unit's rate of fire for a short period of time.||Once activated, there will be a cooling off period before the ability can be used again.

Toggle ring bayonets||Fixing bayonets allows units to engage in melee attacks.||Ring bayonets allow units to continue firing after fixing bayonet. ||Due to their design, ring bayonets slow the reload times of your units.This makes for deadly close range combat.
Toggle rockets||Rockets are capable of a deadly bombardment.||Although deadly when they find their target, rockets are wildly inaccurate.
Toggle round shot||Round shot is a standard metal cannon ball, capable of firing from any cannon type.

Second Wind||This reduces fatigue of the activating unit and affects up to three units within its area of influence.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.
Armour-piercing Shell||High velocity armour-piercing shell. ||Excellent against iron-plated ships. ||Less firepower than explosive shells but really good accuracy.
Advanced Armour-piercing Shell||High velocity armour-piercing shells with good explosive capabilities||Good against all hull types, even ironclads.
Toggle shrapnel shot||Shrapnel shot explodes in the air, raining hot metal on the enemy below.||Shrapnel shot has a very long range and a devastating effect against infantry.

Toggle skirmish mode||In skirmish mode units will keep a safe distance from the enemy.||Skirmish tactics can be employed to slow an advancing enemy or distract specific units. ||Skirmish units are vulnerable to cavalry charges.
Solid Shot||Default projectile for ships||Cast iron shell without explosives, relatively good against wooden hulls||Average accuracy with good penetration power.
Toggle spear wall formation||This formation is effective against head on cavalry charges.||However, it is vulnerable to flanking manoeuvres.
Toggle spear square formation||This defensive formation is especially effective against cavalry charges.||While in this formation, the unit will be immobile and vulnerable to ranged attacks.

Hold Firm||This greatly increases the defence of the activating unit and affects up to three units within its area of influence, making them unbreakable.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Unlimber/limber artillery||Unlimbering artillery allows you to set up an artillery position.||Limbering artillery allows you to move your artillery if you need to adjust the range, or make a tactical retreat.
Warcry||This affects all enemies nearby, heavily reducing their morale, melee defence and speed.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.
Warcry||This affects all enemies nearby, heavily reducing their morale, melee defence and speed.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Stand and Fight!||The general dismounts and forms up with his bodyguard around him. All friendly units within a large area have their melee attack, firing rate and morale greatly increased, but the general himself is left immobile and vulnerable until the ability is deactivated.
Toggle wedge formation||Wedge formation improves the strength of your cavalry charges.||Due to the nature of this formation switching direction is slow and cumbersome.

Whistling Arrows||Whistling arrows have a fearsome sound, adversely affecting the morale, melee attack and firing rate of all enemy troops they fly over or hit.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Whistling Arrows||Whistling arrows have a fearsome sound, adversely affecting the morale, melee attack and firing rate of all enemy troops they fly over or hit.||Once this ability has been activated, you will have to wait a while before using it again.

Deploy stakes||Deploying stakes provides a very effective barrier against cavalry charges.||Once deployed, stakes remain in place until the end of a battle, protecting the flanks of the army from cavalry attacks.

Successful assassination attempts will kill or wound rival generals or agents, weakening their clan. However, if your agent fails and is discovered it could lead to their death and dishonour for your clan!
Successfully bribing an army can cause some of its men to switch to your side and may reduce the loyalty of its general.

A partial success will result in some of the settlement's garrison joining your side, but if you manage to bribe the entire garrison, the province will belong to your clan. However, be warned that any success will be considered an act of war!
Successfully coercing an army can cause some of its men to join your clan.

Successful conversion will leave agents questioning their path in life. They may be absent for a short while they contemplate their lot or disappear for good as they devote themselves to their new faith!
This will reduce a rival army's morale on the battlefield, making it less effective in combat.
Successfully distracting an army will prevent them from moving on their following turn.
Successfully distracting a local garrison will prevent them from supporting any forces stationed in the settlement.
Successfully enchanting a character will see them abandon their cause and join your clan.
Keep your generals entertained and you will help keep them loyal.
Keeping provincial nobles entertained will inspire them in their daily duties; the province will flourish as a result.

Establish a spy network within a settlement to increase the province's line of sight and help detect armies and agents hidden within its borders. It will also help to prevent rival agents from inciting revolts.
Successfully harassing an army inflicts casualties upon and demoralises the units within it.
Hunt down a target to imprison or execute them.
Incite a revolt to destabilise a province, perhaps even leading to a full rebellion!
Successful indoctrination will leave agents questioning their path in life. They may be absent whilst they contemplate their lot or disappear for good, entirely devoted to their new faith!
This increases an army's morale on the battlefield and decreases actions performed against it by rival agents.
Instilling troops with discipline increases their ability to defend themselves in melee combat.
Instilling troops with fervour increases the bonus that they receive when charging into melee combat.
This will increase happiness within the settlement and decrease actions performed against it by rival agents.
Overseeing an army will increase its general's loyalty and increase its defence against ninja.
This will increase a settlement's tax revenue and reduce actions performed against it by rival ninja.
Successfully pay rival agents off and they will abandon their master's cause.
Successfully persuading an army can cause some of its men to join your clan.
Rallying the populace produces happiness relative to the proportion of the province who support your clan's allegiance.

Securing the allegiance of the local lord will grant you the entire province, although you may only be able to secure the allegiance of some of the castle garrison. Be warned; unless a clan is pledging its last province to you, securing the allegiance of a province or part of its garrison will be considered an act of war!
Sabotaging an army will halt its movement for one season and kill a few of its men.
If your agent is successful in this mission, the gates of the castle will be open on the battlefield, making it easier to seize.
Sabotaging a settlement will reduce any bonuses it produces until it is repaired.
Scouting will increase an army's movement and line of sight.
Successful seduction will result in a rival character leaving their clan and joining your side. Be warned; resorting to such an action will be considered an act of war!
Rivals may be killed or wounded in single combat.
Successfully distracting an army will halt its movement for one season.
Subduing dissidents produces repression relative to the proportion of the province who do not support your clan's allegiance.
Supervising recruitment decreases the cost of recruiting units within a province.
Training troops allows them to gain experience outside of battle.
My lord! We are in luck! The damage means the gates are open!
My lord! The gates are broken. The damage was not repaired!
My lord, our ninja have sabotaged the gates!
My lord, enemy ninja have sabotaged our gates!
This force already has the maximum number of agents within it.
This settlement already has the maximum number of agents within it.
You cannot sabotage already damaged castle gates.
You cannot sabotage a fully damaged building.
You cannot request allegiance from a province when the daimyo is present (unless the province is the clan's only province)
Influence in this province is too low. Increase influence over 50%
You already have the maximum number of this agent type.
You cannot bribe a clan capital.
You cannot bribe your parent clan, nor any clans they are at peace with.
The Shogunate's grasp is too strong this close to Kyoto, its citizens will not dare rebel.
You cannot incite a revolt in provinces ruled by clans of the same allegiance
You may not enchant agents who do not adhere to your allegiance.
You cannot perform this action on another player in a cooperative campaign.
An enemy counter agent reduces your chance of success.
The target is a well-protected family member and harder to assassinate.
The target has a very high loyalty rating, making him harder to bribe.
The strength of faith of the opposing religion reduces your success chance.
This building is very secure, making it harder to sabotage.
You cannot incite revolts in rebel provinces.
You do not have enough money to perform this action.
Your chances of success are too slight for your agent to perform this action.
This target is naturally resistant against your agent.
You may not distract local garrisons comprising only a single unit.
Rebels are already active in this province.
Cannot request allegiance from a major clan's last province.
Cannot request allegiance from a clan with the same allegiance.

If a target clan owns more than one province or your junsatsushi manages to win the support of only a portion of their garrisoned forces, securing a pledge of allegiance will result in war between you.
Cannot ally with an enemy of your allies.
Propose an alliance.||Allies can be asked for help in the event of war.||It is useful to be on friendly terms with a clan before requesting an alliance.
Cannot ally with another clan's vassal.
You cannot create alliances when you are another clan's vassal.
Cannot ally with an ally of your enemies.
This force is inside an enemy zone of control and cannot move. Attacking the enemy is its only option.
You have already mastered this art.
You are currently studying this art.
Unavailable. You have not mastered the arts needed to study this. Left-click to set up a research goal.
Fleets ending their turn here will suffer attrition from coastal defences.
In winter, armies will suffer losses due to attrition if they are in enemy territory.
Units in your army are immune from winter attrition.
This is an area of ATTRITION. Armies will suffer losses here due to the extreme heat.
Units in your army are immune from desert attrition.
Ships that move here will suffer attrition
Right-click on this button to toggle auto-triggering of this ability for the selected units
Costly Enemy Victory||The enemy has won, but it has cost them dear. Their dead litter the field!
Crushing Defeat||This is a shameful defeat! Your men died honourably but to no purpose, slaughtered by your foes!
Close Defeat||Ah! The enemy have defeated you, but your efforts were valiant and almost successful.
Decisive Defeat||Truly: shame and dishonour will stain this day's memory. This is a terrible defeat to suffer!
Close Defeat||Victory has eluded your grasp. The enemy triumphs, but by little.
Decisive Defeat||There is no doubt: defeat is your fate. Your men are scattered or dead.
Crushing Defeat||There is nothing to take from this day but shame and dishonour. The enemy victory is remarkable.
Costly Victory||You are victorious, but at what cost? Many have paid the ultimate price for this victory.
Heroic Victory||This is victory, glorious, heroic, magnificent victory! Your foes are utterly crushed!
Close Victory||Almost they defeated you, but you have snatched victory! The enemy dead are testament to that!
Decisive Victory||There can be no doubt: this is a great victory! The enemy are dead, or running for their lives!
Close Victory||The enemy is broken! Death and dishonour are theirs today, but only by a single sword stroke!
Decisive Victory|The enemy are dead, or fleeing to save their dishonourable lives! You have your victory!
Heroic Victory||The battle is done, and the heads counted! This is a notable victory!
Coercing a non-hostile force is an act of war.
Enchanting a non-hostile character is an act of war.
Persuading a non-hostile force is an act of war.
Modernisation progress towards next clan development level
Independent clan influence from neighbouring provinces
Your daimyo has already changed his domain's allegiance; you will not be able to revert until he has been succeeded by another daimyo.
Your domain has come too far to change its allegiance now.

Click here to turn your back on the Shogunate and support the Imperial cause.||A daimyo may change his domain's allegiance once during his lifetime. Be warned; this can result in public order problems and will affect how you are perceived diplomatically.

Click here to abandon the Imperial cause and support the Shogunate.||A daimyo may change his domain's allegiance once during his lifetime. Be warned; this can result in public order problems and will affect how you are perceived diplomatically.
You are about to change your allegiance. You will not be able to revert until a new daimyo rules your domain and may experience public order and diplomatic difficulties. Do you wish to continue?
Although lord of your domain, you have yet to prove your greater worth.
Your efforts have not gone unnoticed; you have been granted the rank of shonagon - junior councillor to the Imperial Court.
Your efforts have not gone unnoticed; you have been granted the position of bugyo - a governor within the Shogunate.
The Emperor acknowledges your achievements; you have been promoted to the rank of dainagon - senior councillor to the Imperial Court.
The Shogun acknowledges your achievements; you have been promoted to the rank of wakadoshiyori - a young elder within the Shogunate.
Your loyal service to the Emperor is greatly appreciated; you have been promoted to the position of daijo daijin - Imperial chancellor of state.
Your loyal service to the Shogun is greatly appreciated; you have been promoted to the rank of roju - an elder within the Shogunate.
Your exploits have made you indispensible to the Emperor's cause; in honour of this, you have been declared kampaku - the Imperial regent!
Weary of the warmongering ways of Japan's old lords, you have declared independence and now seek to unify the country under your own banner.
Your exploits have made you indispensible to the Shogun's cause; in honour of this, you have been declared Tairo - the Shogunate's great elder!

Demand breaking of an alliance||You can ask that a clan breaks its alliance with another.||This is useful if they are an ally of one of your enemies.||The proposal is more likely to be accepted if they value your friendship over the other clan.
There are no alliances to break.
Demand a trade embargo against another clan.||You can ask a clan to join you in a trade embargo against another clan.||This is a good way of depriving an enemy of essential funds.
Bribing a non-hostile clan is an act of war.
Concentrated fire from all guns on one side. More accurate and stronger than fire-at-will. Sending multiple ships to attack a single target with broadsides can really turn the tide in battle.
This unfinished building is damaged and all construction on it has halted. Select it and click the 'Repair' button to fix it and continue the construction, or demolish it using the 'Demolish' button.
Cancelling the repair of this unfinished building will leave it in a damaged state. Construction on it will not start again until it has been repaired.
Click here to cancel development on damaged constructions.
Click here to repair the unfinished building so that construction on it can continue.

Click this button to cancel any action on the currently selected item.
You must select an item before using this button.
Manual saves not allowed in campaign. In battle, orders cannot be issued when paused.

There is little knowledge of your family.
Your family is respected across Japan.
Many - the Imperial house included - now fear your potential.
Your family has grown too powerful - the Imperial house has rallied the people against you and your allies. You are an enemy of the state!

Fame is gained by fighting battles and conquering provinces and is also influenced by other factors, such as your daimyo's honour.||As your family's fame increases, other powers - including your sister family - will begin to fear you and the Imperial house may see you as a threat to their authority.

Fame is gained by fighting battles and conquering provinces and is also influenced by other factors, such as your daimyo's honour.||As your clan's fame increases, the Emperor or Shogun will recognise you as a great asset or threat to their cause. Whomever you choose to support may eventually call for your leadership of their loyalist forces.

Promoting your avatar will advance his prestige level. This will have the following effects:

 The conquest map will be reset.

 All retainers that are gained from the conquest map will be reset.

 All armour pieces will be retained.

 All your current veteran units will be retained.

 10 extra veteran slots will be gained.

 All clan tokens will be retained.

 All steam stats and achievements will be retained.

 Your avatar’s cost will increase.

 Promoted avatars require more XP to increase rank

Forest||Forests are highly effective at hiding units, but greatly reduce the combat ability and speed of cavalry units.
Road|| All units move quicker on roads.
Rough Ground|| Horses are slowed down by rough terrain.
Scrub|| Provides cover for light infantry units.
Shallow water||Shallow water slows down all units. Cavalry units are particularly affected.

Skill Tree Reset||Resetting skill tree will cost 3 clan tokens and will reset skill points and skill traits
Fog||Reduced visibility. All ships and missile units fire with reduced accuracy and range, and enemy units are concealed by fog at long distance.

Rain||Gunpowder weapons are slower to reload and archers may not use flaming arrows. It is more difficult to ignite fires in buildings and ships, and units take longer to recover from fatigue when idle.
Snow||Units take longer to recover from fatigue when idle.
